intro: Maytenus chubutensis, commonly known as the Chubut mayten, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Patagonian region of Argentina. It belongs to the family Cornaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to the harsh climate of its native habitat. Maytenus chubutensis is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting biodiversity in arid environments.
